title.narrative: District Lead Agency for Start Network Drought Early Action Systems – ZIMBABWE

description.narrative: The Lead Start member Agency for each district is receiving funds from an ARC Replica pay-out or contingency fund disbursement from Start Network and would be accountable for implementing the Early Action interventions in the specific district along with their local partners (where applicable) and in complementarity with Start Network members and other humanitarian actors. Africa Risk Capacity [ARC] Replica is an insurance product offered by ARC Ltd to WFP and other humanitarian partners as an innovative approach to expand climate risk insurance coverage to more people and improve the effectiveness of emergency humanitarian response in vulnerable African countries prone to climate risks. Under the proposed START Network intervention, CAFOD based on the organizational profiles has been allocated Gokwe North and Binga districts to contribute to increasing early response capacity to drought. This proposed action from CAFOD, implemented through Caritas Hwange will ensure that affected vulnerable populations receive early support to avoid disrupting coping mechanisms, protect livelihoods, reduce the cost of the intervention and ultimately save more lives.
